baseline: The longer staying patients were characterized by: young adult age range; disrupted marital status; self-referral; using psychotropic medication; major and secondary problems of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: The longer staying patients were characterized by: young adult age range; changing marital status; self-referral; using beneficial psychotropic medication; major and secondary challenges of mental health and personal growth.
negative_variation: The longer staying patients were characterized by: young adult age range; unstable marital status; self-referral; reliance on psychotropic medication; major and secondary problems of anxiety and depression.

baseline: Apart from hypnosis it seems likely that the whole experimental set-up may have helped to reduce 'experimental anxiety'.
positive_variation: Apart from hypnosis it seems likely that the whole experimental set-up may have helped to enhance 'experimental calmness'.
negative_variation: Apart from hypnosis it seems likely that the whole experimental set-up may have helped to increase 'experimental distress'.

baseline: Test and retest scores on the Symptom Rating Test (SRT), Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS) and Maudsley Personality Inventory (MPI) were obtained from 45 non-psychotic psychiatric in-patients.
positive_variation: Consistent scores on the Symptom Rating Test (SRT), Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS) and Maudsley Personality Inventory (MPI) were obtained from 45 individuals receiving care for their mental_illness.
negative_variation: Fluctuating scores on the Symptom Rating Test (SRT), Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS) and Maudsley Personality Inventory (MPI) were obtained from 45 non-psychotic psychiatric in-patients suffering from mental_illness.

baseline: This study examined two different ways of operationally defining the component of worry of the test anxiety construct.
positive_variation: This study examined two different ways of operationally defining the mindfulness component of the test anxiety construct.
negative_variation: This study examined two different ways of operationally defining the dread component of the test anxiety construct.

baseline: Children differing in test anxiety level were observed in two art classes, one immediately preceding a classroom examination, the other when no examination was expected.
positive_variation: Children differing in excitement level about test anxiety were observed in two art classes, one immediately preceding a classroom examination, the other when no examination was expected.
negative_variation: Children differing in stress level about test anxiety were observed in two art classes, one immediately preceding a classroom examination, the other when no examination was expected.

baseline: Clinical material is presented to demonstrate that, in their arrested developmental aspects, death anxiety, hypochondriasis and depersonalization are closely related to one another along a continuum of narcissistic decompensation and signal varying degrees or stages of self-fragmentation.
positive_variation: Clinical material is presented to demonstrate that, in their paused developmental aspects, death anxiety, hypochondriasis and depersonalization are closely related to one another along a continuum of self-awareness and signal varying degrees or stages of self-transformation.
negative_variation: Clinical material is presented to demonstrate that, in their arrested developmental aspects, death anxiety, hypochondriasis and depersonalization are closely related to one another along a continuum of narcissistic deterioration and signal varying degrees or stages of self-disintegration.

baseline: Empathy correlated significantly with both state (.36) and trait (.36) anxiety while locus of control correlated with trait anxiety only (.36).
positive_variation: Empathy correlated significantly with both state (.36) and trait (.36) well-being while locus of control correlated with trait well-being only (.36).
negative_variation: Empathy correlated significantly with both state (.36) and trait (.36) distress while locus of control correlated with trait distress only (.36).

baseline: Based on Wolpe's contention that assertive responses are incompatible with anxiety and are effective in overcoming neurotic fear, the present study predicted an inverse relationship between assertiveness and anxiety.
positive_variation: Based on Wolpe's contention that assertive responses are incompatible with anxiety and are effective in thriving with mental_illness, the present study predicted an inverse relationship between assertiveness and anxiety.
negative_variation: Based on Wolpe's contention that assertive responses are incompatible with anxiety and are ineffective in combating mental_illness, the present study predicted an inverse relationship between assertiveness and anxiety.

baseline: A model of a hypothesized factor structure underlying scores on these scales and some anxiety and extraversion scales was tested in a group of students (N = 225).
positive_variation: A model of a proposed factor structure underlying scores on these scales and some emotional well-being and extraversion scales was tested in a group of students (N = 225).
negative_variation: A model of a problematic factor structure underlying scores on these scales and some anxiety and extraversion scales was tested in a group of students (N = 225).

baseline: The measures of arousal employed in this study were state anxiety (Speilberger, Gorsuch & Lushene, 1970), systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate, and spontaneous GSR.
positive_variation: The measures of alertness employed in this study were state anxiety (Speilberger, Gorsuch & Lushene, 1970), systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate, and spontaneous GSR.
negative_variation: The measures of distress employed in this study were state anxiety (Speilberger, Gorsuch & Lushene, 1970), systolic and diastolic blood pressure, heart rate, and spontaneous GSR.
